name: Mind-Alliance Systems
overview:
Mind-Alliance provides Information Sharing Management (ISM) software that enables companies, government agencies, and non-profit organizations to improve collaboration, produce more reliable contingency plans, and enhance performance by improving the flow of information to decision makers.

The Mind-Alliance enterprise collaboration and task management application, called “Channels” enables enterprises to produce information sharing and collaboration protocols; task assignments with context about: · When the task is due (scheduling) and events that trigger the need to do the task · Who needs to receive or send information when executing the task · Locations where the task needs to be performed · Other tasks that are inter-connected and dependent on task completion

With Channel, enterprises can: · Improve Plan Execution and Organizational Performance – See you’re your team’s tasks are progressing. Spot dependencies and impending delays. Intervene to reprioritize tasks. Make the flow of information to decision-makers faster and more reliable. · Increase Operational Resilience and Crisis Response – Publish security, emergency and business continuity response protocols. Verify that everyone knows their assigned roles, and with whom they need to communicate in a crisis. · Retain organizational knowledge – Capture best-practice know-how and know-who. Minimize the impact of employee turnover. Support integration after reorganization, mergers or acquisitions

Enterprises use Channels to collaboratively design and manage work in several ways: · Top-down, by planners and managers who define protocols for critical tasks, assign them to people in the relevant roles and then review task execution · Bottom-Up – by workers who use define their own tasks, negotiate with colleagues and reach agreement about inter-connected tasks and communication. · Collaboratively, by a group of managers and workers
